contentfulPagePressRelease.title: Sidra to Host Scholarship Open Day for Nationals

childMarkdownRemark.html:
High school students (Qatari’s and those with Qatari mothers) who are interested in studying medicine or allied health related majors are invited to a scholarship open day at Sidra Medical and Research Center (Sidra).

Sidra is hosting the scholarship open day at its Outpatient Clinic in Education City from 8.00 p.m. to 11.00 p.m. on Monday, 12 June 2017.

Students and their parents are invited to the Sidra Outpatient Clinic where they will be able to talk to national development officers about scholarship opportunities, hear from sponsored healthcare professionals about their journey of growth and development supported by Sidra. They will also be able to apply for scholarships on the spot. Students will be required to carry their national ID cards with them to register.

Scholarships are being offered for students (Qatari and those with Qatari mothers), including ﬁnancial and non-ﬁnancial assistance, in a variety of universities in Qatar and internationally which are listed on the Ministry of Education and Higher Education’s (MOE) website.

Upon graduation, the scholarship recipients will take up positions at Sidra – working towards the realization of its three essential missions: Patient Care, Medical Education and Biomedical Research.

Scholarships are available for the following types of degrees:
  • Medical Degree or equivalent
  • Bachelor (Nursing, Pharmacy and Psychology)
  • Allied Health programs offered at the College of North Atlantic - Qatar
  • Technician programs (Ultrasound Tech, Laboratory Tech and Anesthesia Tech)

For more details including general admission requirements please visit: http://www.sidra.org/education-center/national-development/scholarship-program/or contact the National Development team on scholarship@sidra.org.
